title: Drawing, Rendering of Various Decorative details of Bologna; Verso: Architectural Details, 1810–14
title_raw: Rendering of Various Decorative details of Bologna; Verso: Architectural Details
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
markings: Watermark: lily in double circle with ACF
inscribed: Inscribed at top: Dela Rovare.  Bottom, inscribed by capitals: Gotico munumento. Inscribed under decorative design: monumenti cavati dal cinquecento Bologna. Inscribed at top center: 116. Verso: inscribed at top: 117.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Sketchbook Page: Folio 58, 116, 117. Double sided folio. Recto: left half of grotesque panel, c. 1500. Left half shows square ceiling and coat of arms of Pope Julius II (1503-13), with inscription: Dela Rovare. Center row:  Renaissance candelabrum, gothic doorway, 15th century trophy of pastoral attributes. Capital with eagle and dragon. Bottom: three capitals, one of them with inscription: Gotico munumento. Inscribed under decorative design: monumenti cavati dal cinquecento Bologna. Inscribed at top center: 116. Verso:  arcades, parts of columns, entablatures, and capitals. At bottom left, seven decorated moldings. Inscribed at top: 117.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Rendering of Various Decorative details of Bologna; Verso: Architectural Details, 1810–14. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1929
